name: Bulbophyllum depressum
description: Bulbophyllum depressum is an epiphytic orchid native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Malaysia, Indonesia, and the Philippines. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and features creeping rhizomes (10-20 cm long) with small, dramatic, oval-shaped, dark green leaves and distinctive flattened pseudobulbs. The plant displays a creeping growth habit. Orchids have highly specialized flowers designed for specific pollinators. In its native habitat, it grows on tree branches in tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant brings exotic elegance and sophistication to any environment. It's popular among orchid enthusiasts for its unique flattened pseudobulbs.
careTips: Water when media begins to dry
Bright indirect light - avoid direct sun
Feed with orchid fertilizer during growing season
